intro: Scleria alata, commonly known as the spurred grass, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, triangular leaves. Its flowers are clustered in spikelets and are typically pale green to brown in color. Scleria alata is often found in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and inland environments.
